publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: A Poem wrote Anno 1724, upon Mr 08. Wood's obtaining a Patent to Coin Half\inserted·pence\ & Farthings, for the Kingdom of Ireland.
When first the Squire and Tinker Wood,
Gravely consulting Ireland's Good,
Together mingled in a Mass
Smith's Dust and Copper, lead and Brass;
The Mixture, thus by Chymick Art,
United Close, in every Part,
In Fillets Roll'd, or cutt in Peices,
Appear'd like one Continued Species,
And by the Forming Engine Struck,
On all the Same Impression Stuck,
So to Confound this Hated Coin,
All Parties and Religions Ioyn;
Whigs, Tories, Trimmers, Hannoverians,
Quakers, Conformists, Presbyterians,
Scotch, Irish, English, French Unite
With Equal Interest: Equal Spite;
Together Mingled in a Lump
Do All, in one Opinion Iump
And Every One begins to find
The Same Impression on his Mind.
A Strange Event, whom Gold encites,
To Blood and Quarrels, Brass Unites.
So Goldsmiths say, the Coarsest Stuff,
Will serve, for Sodder well enough,
So by the Kettle's loud Allarm
The Bees are Gather'd to a Swarm
So by the Brazen Trumpets Bluster
Troops of all Tongues and Nations Muster,
And So the Harp of Ireland brings,
Whole Crowds, about it's Brazen Strings.
There is a Chain, Let Down from Iove
But Fasten'd, to his Throne Above,
So Strong that from the Lower End,
They Say, all Human things Descend;
This Chain, as Ancient Poets Hold,
When Iove was young, was made of Gold;
Prometheus, this Chain Purloin'd,
Dissolv'd, and into Money Coin'd
Then Whipp's him on a Chain of Brass,
Venus was Brib'd, to let itt Pass.
Now While this Brazen Chain Prevail'd,
Iove, saw that all Devotion Fail'd,
No Temple to His Godship Rais'd
No Sacrifice, on Altars Blaz'd
In Short such dire Confusions Follow'd
Earth must have been, in Chaos Swallow'd;
Iove stood Amaz'd, but Looking Round;
With much Ado, the cheat he Found.
'Twas Plain he coud no Longer hold,
The World, in any Chain but Gold,
So to the God, of Wealth his Brother
Sent Mercury to Gett Another.
Prometheus on a Rock is Laid,
Ty'd wtḥ the Chain himself had made;
On Icy Caucasus to Shiver
While Vultures eat his Growing Liver.
Yee Powers, of Grubb Street, make me Able,
Discreetly to Apply this Fable,
Say who is to be Understood,
By that Old thief Prometheus (Wood)
For Iove itt is not hard to Guess him,
I mean his Majesty God Bless him;
This Thief, & Blacksmith was so Bold,
He Strove to Steal that Chain of Gold,
Wcḥ links the Subject to the King,
And change itt, to a Brazen String.
But Sure, if Nothing Else, must Pass
Between, the King, and Us but Brass,
Altho, the Chain, will never Crack,
Yett, Our Devotion, may Grow Slack;
But Iove, will soon convert I hope,
The Brazen Chain, into a Rope,
With wcḥ Prometheus, shall be ty'd
And High in Air, for ever Ride;
Where if we Find his Liver Grows,
For Want of Vultures, we have Crows.
